comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @zanyrenney (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @robertKozik (`External`)
This issue is mentioned [in here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30884#issuecomment-1793453231) with the fix for it. I think we should close this one

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.

After adding a receipt to the manual request, page refresh causes manual request to be stuck

### What is the root cause of that problem?

When we adding a receipt to the manual request, we create blob URL and set it to the iou
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/pages/iou/ReceiptSelector/index.js#L135-L136
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/pages/iou/ReceiptSelector/index.js#L154-L155

But this object URL is only valid for the current session and will be revoked once the page is refreshed. So when navigating to the confirmation page, file would be null and it'll be redirected to the manual request page or previous page.
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7bd51eba84f6708409dfd6e6886bf968eff3358f/src/pages/iou/steps/MoneyRequestConfirmPage.js#L106-L109

This is the root cause

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?

I don't think we need to go back to the manual request page when object URL is not valid.
I suggest to reset the receipt in this case

Update the above code to
```
        FileUtils.readFileAsync(props.iou.receiptPath, props.iou.receiptFilename).then((file) => {
            if (!file) {
                IOU.setMoneyRequestReceipt('', '');
            } else {
```


<details>
    <summary>Result</summary>


https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/126839717/a530ef22-a62e-4c72-95b2-dd63bb0ba697


</details>

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)

(FROM UPWORK)
Edit: I apologize for not reading the contributor guidlines in full prior to the proposal. Previous  proposal retained for posterity.

Restatement of the Problem
The issue at hand is maintaining accessibility to a receipt file in a React Native application across page reloads. When a user attaches a receipt to a manual IOU request, it's stored as a local file blob. While the application can access this file during the current session, a page reload renders the file inaccessible, even though its reference is still present in the application's state.

Root Cause of the Problem
The core of the problem lies in the session-specific nature of blob URLs created using URL.createObjectURL(). These URLs are only valid within the current browser or app session. When the page or app is reloaded, these blob URLs become invalid, and the corresponding file blobs are no longer accessible, leading to the loss of the file data.

Proposed Solution
To address this issue, the solution involves two key changes:

Conversion to Data URL: When a user attaches a receipt, instead of storing a blob URL, convert the file blob into a data URL. This conversion encodes the file as a Base64 string, which can be stored in the application's state.

Storing and Restoring Data URL: Store this data URL in the IOU state. When the file needs to be accessed (e.g., on MoneyRequestConfirmPage), convert the data URL back into a file blob. This reconversion allows the application to use the file as if it were newly uploaded.





Previous Proposal:
Proposal
Technical Explanation:
The blob is being orphaned making the state representation no longer valid.
Proposed solution:
Convert the blob to a URI/URL

```
convertBlobToDataURL(fileBlob, (dataURL) => {
    // Store dataURL in the state
});
```

```
// After page reload, recreate the blob if needed
const blob = dataURLToBlob(storedDataURL);
```

This should have a streamlined user experience, where the selected file is applied after reload. This may fix the issue in other places of the codebase as well.

1. Make sure you've read and understood the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md).
2. Get the email address used to login to your Expensify account. If you don't already have an Expensify account, create one [here](https://new.expensify.com/). If you have multiple accounts (e.g. one for testing), please use your main account email.
3. Get the link to your Upwork profile. It's necessary because we only pay via Upwork. You can access it by logging in, and then clicking on your name. If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.1-7 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Click on FAB > Request Money 2. Switch to manual 3. Enter the amount and click on next 4. Choose a user 5. Go to more (the three dots) and Add a Receipt 6. Go back to the user list by clicking the back button 7. Reload page 8. Try choosing a user. Notice that the page keeps returning to the list page ## Expected Result: Choosing a user takes you to the next page ## Actual Result: After choosing a user, the page keeps returning back to the list page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/898d9efb-bfe7-45ba-a88b-0a31a8035e7c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
